intro: Reseda incisa, commonly known as slender catchfly, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and thrives in open habitats such as grasslands and heaths. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and branching. Reseda incisa is often found in disturbed areas and can be a pioneer species in ecological succession.
